title: Without the DUP, Boris Johnson needs an election win or real no-deal threat to drive his Brexit deal home
text:
The only fly in Boris Johnson's ointment as he celebrates his "great new deal" with the European Union is that the Democratic Unionist Party is refusing to support it.

As staunch unionists, the DUP has made clear it will not accept anything that sees Northern Ireland treated differently from the rest of the United Kingdom. And under the terms of Mr Johnson's proposed deal, Northern Ireland would stay in the EU's VAT regime and still be bound by the Union law and the jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice.

The implications of Northern Ireland's half-in-half-out status were spelled out bluntly by some pundits, who warned that the DUP risked effectively backing a border down the Irish Sea....
